intro: Dianthus suskalovicii, commonly known as the Karakachan dianthus, is a flowering plant native to Bulgaria. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, pinkish-red flowers. The plant typically blooms in late spring to early summer, producing clusters of small, delicate petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or alpine settings. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native region.
